instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V35_CAM: What is PP1V35_CAM? PP1V35_CAM is a 1.35v power rail to power the webcam. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Webcam
threads.message: Hey all, having issues with a stubborn 00840 board. Came in for liquid damage and a new screen, repaired the liquid damage and the board is working great except for the webcam. In system report it doesn't show up at all, tested with a known good display assembly. ALS does work however. I checked all the components between J8500 and <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>, and everything is in spec according to OpenBoardData values in FlexBV. Also checked all the surrounding components around <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>, same thing. What else should I be checking next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Webcam
threads.message:
In page 37, apart of small coils, appear some caps to ground.
Check if any is corroded.
Compare diode mode to ground readings on camera lines with good board.
There is an R/C pair on page 66 too (for SCL/SDA).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Webcam
threads.message: Did a double check on my initial measurements and I found that <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> is missing. I have <SIGNAL>CAMERA_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>. <SIGNAL>CAMERA_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is not low. What else do I need to get this rail to come on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Webcam
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> is generated by <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>.
Check first diode mode to ground.
Be sure all related components are good.
If all OK, change <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Webcam
threads.message: Changing <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> solved this one, thanks! Took a few times to get it to sit perfectly.
